Compute the circular median of a set of angles (radians)

Source: R/summarise_angle.R
median_angle.Rd

The function returns the mean direction of a numeric vector of angles, wrapping the result to the interval [0, 2*pi). It leverages the wrap_angle() and calculate_angular_difference() helpers that you already defined.

Usage

median_angle(ang)

Arguments

ang

Numeric vector of angles (radians). May contain values outside [0, 2*pi); they are normalised internally.

Value

A single numeric value in [0, 2*pi) representing the circular mean.

Examples

median_angle(c(pi/2, 1.5 * pi))   # → 0
#> [1] 3.141593
median_angle(c(0, pi))           # → pi
#> [1] 1.570796
